isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR 3406B -1991 - DESCRIPTION - Transducer Module

svcproc.title: Transducer Module
svcproc.para: The sealed transducer module, mounted below the electronic governor, contains an engine oil pressure sensor, a boost pressure sensor, an inlet air pressure sensor, and protective signal conditioning circuitry. The oil pressure sensor is used to limit engine speed and power output if low oil pressure occurs. The boost sensor is used to control smoke during engine acceleration. The inlet air pressure sensor is used to protect the engine during operation with a plugged air cleaner or at high altitudes.
